title: People in Bronze give up so easily...
body: Seriously, why? People will give up when theyve only died twice, or they are just losing their lane but everyone else is doing well and just start recklessly feeding. League is a game where a comeback can be made with one good teamfight, but these people just sabotage all hope of salvaging a win. It's just so frustrating...

replies.body: that is why they are in bronze

Yeah and it helps keep me out of ever leaving bronze ;_; 
The past 8 or so games I was crushing my lane and getting good roaming ganks off im the first 20, but one or two people would always give up and start feeding.
As long as you don't give up try not to worry about it.  You'll eventually climb and they'll be stuck because of bad attitude towards matches

It's half of a self sustaining cycle.  Players get discouraged when they play poorly and a fair number of players(often some of the same) will treat teammates poorly for little mistakes like first blood or missing a cannon minion.  Finding a more fluid way to foster positive thinking would help quite a number of these players perform better.  It sucks that more often than not teammates will jump at the chance to point out mistakes rather than simply going "dont worry, we still got this"

I never understood why people shit talk their own teammates, that doesn't help anything. I had a game yesterday where our jungler called me a "suiciding tard" for dying once to a lvl 6 Illaoi gank under my tower...

I understand the feeling.  It seems like it might be caused partly due to how few positive role models get a spotlight and how infrequently the ones that do stick out get noticed.  It would be refreshing to see a way for higher level players to properly mentor players that want to improve, yet not force molds on said beginners so they can still learn on their own.
It happens at all elo sadly except Master and above. Even then their are some matches it happens still.
You cannot make comebacks with idiots that can't stop dying. FF and don't waste time. Your next team might actually be smart.
So you just give the enemy team free LP and give your up at the slightest sign of struggle? Typical.

> [{quoted}](name=Galacticamaru,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=5t4TB1dX,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2016-08-10T19:42:20.176+0000)
>
> So you just give the enemy team free LP and give your up at the slightest sign of struggle? Typical.

I'm not the one currently struggling to get out of Bronze mate. Want to know how I got out ? I focused everything in learning how to carry idiots so when they start feeding and doing idiotic things, I could bring it back. While it's a million times easier to do in Bronze than Silver, there were many times I failed to get a lead. If I can't carry and my team mates are doing bad, I'm ready to forfeit. My only goal then would be to try not to fuck up next game so I can carry when my team mates when they inevitable feed. 

If your team mates are feeding and you are feeling helpless to do anything because you're 0-7, then something went wrong. Don't waste your time. If your team mates are feeding and you're feeling like a God that decides who lives and dies because your 10-2 with 200 CS and 3000 gold to spend, then you have done something right. In Bronze you should be learning how to stomp and get fed because you 100% cannot rely on your allies. You have to rely on yourself. If you're not the one carrying then it's a waste of your time. This is the mentality you need to get out.

Occasionally you get games where one of your allies is carrying hard so its best to make yourself easy to carry by not feeding and applying pressure but these games are very very rare. You will have to be the one carrying 95% of your games to climb out.

TLDR; In Bronze its either you stomp games or ff.

I can definitely see the carry mentality. I play a lot of Pantheon so I can stomp my lane hard and try to snowball other lanes every time my ult is off cd, but I fall off so hard late game that I have to rely on my team mates.

Hmm. I've been reviewing your match list and the very 1st thing that stood out to me was your CS. Your farm is far too low. To be honest, I'm surprised you actually made it to B2 without fixing this. In one game you had 95 CS in a 30 minute game. You should be nearing 300 CS, 200 at the very least. I'm 100% sure this is what is holding you back from reaching Silver. It's the number one thing that got me out of Bronze.

Oh gosh, that game was rough. Our Jungler dced really early in and their Nocturne had complete control of the map. You couldnt go near your farm without gettin ganked. But my cs is definitely something I need to work on.
From my experience, it is like that on every elo, most players in League give up easily
